inlineContent.text: CFPropertyList provides functions that convert property list objects to and from several serialized formats such as XML. The
type that denotes CFPropertyList objects is an abstract type for property list objects. Depending on the contents of the XML data used to create the property list,

can be any of the property list objects: CFData, CFString, CFArray, CFDictionary, CFDate, CFBoolean, and CFNumber. Note that if you use a property list to generate XML, the keys of any dictionaries in the property list must be CFString objects.

It is important to understand that CFPropertyList provides an abstraction for all the property list types—you can think of CFPropertyList in object-oriented terms as being the superclass of CFString, CFNumber, CFDictionary, and so on. When a Core Foundation function returns a
, it means that the value may be any of the property list types. For example,
. This means that the value returned can be a CFString object, a CFNumber object, a CFDictionary object, and so on again. You can use
to determine what type of object a property list value is.
functions to create a property list object given an existing property list object, raw XML data (as in a file), or a stream. You can also convert a property list object to XML using the
function to write a property list to an output stream, and validate a property list object using the

function. CFPropertyList properly takes care of endian issues—a property list (whether represented by a stream, XML, or a CFData object) created on a PowerPC-based Macintosh is correctly interpreted on an Intel-based Macintosh, and vice versa.
For code examples illustrating how to read and write property list files, see

abstract.text: Creates an XML representation of the specified property list.
Creates a property list using data from a stream.
Creates a property list using the specified XML or binary property list data.
Recursively creates a copy of a given property list.
Returns a CFData object containing a serialized representation of a given property list in a specified format.
Write the bytes of a serialized property list out to a stream.
Creates a property list from a given CFData object.
Determines if a property list is valid.
Create and return a property list with a CFReadStream input.
Writes the bytes of a property list serialization out to a stream.
The CFFileDescriptor provides an opaque type to monitor file descriptors for read and write activity via CFRunLoop.
A reference to a CFPropertyList object.

Option flags that determine the degree of mutability of newly created property lists.
Specifies the format of a property list.
Type for flags that determine the degree of mutability of newly created property lists.

CFStringTokenizer allows you to tokenize strings into words, sentences or paragraphs in a language-neutral way. It supports languages such as Japanese and Chinese that do not delimit words by spaces, as well as de-compounding German compounds. You can obtain Latin transcription for tokens. It also provides language identification API.
